greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 2^BigO(n) * 3^omega(n), where BigO=A001222 and omega=A001221, the numbers of prime factors of n with and without repetitions.
comment: for primes p, q with p<>q: a(p) = 6; a(p*q) = 36; a(p^k) = 3*2^k, k>0;
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Factorization
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Smooth number
formula: Multiplicative with p^e -> 3*2^e, p prime and e>0.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 04 2006
